comment.text: After binding acetylcholine, the AChR responds by an extensive change in conformation that affects all subunits and leads to opening of an ion-conducting channel across the plasma membrane. The channel is blocked by alpha-bungarotoxin.

Homopentamer (By similarity). Interacts with RIC3; which is required for proper folding and assembly (PubMed:15504725, PubMed:16120769). Interacts with LYPD6 (PubMed:27344019). Interacts with the alpha-conotoxin RgIA (By similarity). Interacts with alpha-conotoxins ImI and ImII (PubMed:15609996).
May be produced at very low levels due to a premature stop codon in the mRNA, leading to nonsense-mediated mRNA decay.
Belongs to the ligand-gated ion channel (TC 1.A.9) family. Acetylcholine receptor (TC 1.A.9.1) subfamily. Alpha-7/CHRNA7 sub-subfamily.

property.value: Neuronal nicotinic acetylcholine receptor complex, alpha7
Neuronal nicotinic acetylcholine receptor complex, alpha7-beta2
the neurotransmitter receptor, cys loop, ligand-gated ion channel (lic) family
Highly calcium permeable postsynaptic nicotinic acetylcholine receptors
Expressed in adrenal tissue and 111 other tissues
C:integral component of postsynaptic specialization membrane
P:negative regulation of interleukin-1 beta production
P:negative regulation of tumor necrosis factor production
P:positive regulation of cell population proliferation
P:positive regulation of ERK1 and ERK2 cascade
P:positive regulation of excitatory postsynaptic potential
P:positive regulation of heart rate involved in baroreceptor response to decreased systemic arterial blood pressure
P:positive regulation of long-term synaptic potentiation
P:positive regulation of protein metabolic process
P:regulation of amyloid precursor protein catabolic process

feature.description: 115-fold more potently inhibited by the alpha-conotoxin ImI; but no change in inhibition by the alpha-conotoxin ImII.
